text.section: The Board may, by ordinance or resolution, establish a Human Relations Commission for the County.

The purpose of the Commission is to:
Promote understanding and harmony of relationship between the people of the County through the study of the nature and causes of social friction and prejudice;
Advance the means for the alleviation of social friction and prejudice; and
Otherwise further the American ideal of equality and justice.
The Commission shall use its influence and persuasion to direct the community's efforts to the solution of all those problems which many times are the basic reasons for racial tensions.

The Commission shall encourage and ensure equal treatment of all persons, without regard to race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, marital status, or physical or mental handicap, in compliance with federal, State, and local laws and regulations related to housing, employment, and public accommodations.
